content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
												Great game to chew up hours of free time. Play almost 100 hours and I will never regret those hours spent playing the  DayZ mod optional with the game, which I encourage you to try. Look up popularly known Youtube content creators like JackFrags, FRANKIEonPCin1080p (I know he had a couple of scandals regarding the hacking incidents, such a shame) and PsiSyndicate.Fantastic game DayZ is.Although a bit more expense required to play this game compared to other survival games (Rust, Romero's Aftermath and Minecraft etc.) it is still worth a buy. I bought the package with most of the DLC (ArmA 2: Complete Collection, costing $39.99 USD without any sale) making the game look fantastic. Runs extremely well on Windows 7 - 10.There is a deep aspect of survival in this game, making it one of the most realistic zombie post-apocalyptic games on Steam. Heavily refined over the years, Arma 2: DayZ Mod is a fantastic game to play. Great fun with friends and can get lonely playing solo in the in the zombie apocalypse.Does require deep concetration and skill to maximize enjoyment.

Posted: December 31, 2015
												ArmA 2 is the kind of game that was made only for the hardcore military shooter buffs. This game is so challenging and diffcult that it makes Call of Duty and Battlefield look like Angry Birds by comparission. Not everyone will like this game so I only recomended to military buffs and anyone who started playing military shooters back in the late 90's / early 2000's. Remeber the old school Rainbow Six or Ghost Recon, its basically those games on a massive scale. The game pays the greatest attention to details and realism as players must work with their team to complte their objective. Be it the single-player or multiplayer, ArmA 2 is true gift to the hardcore gamer.The exspansion packs / DLCs also add to the longevity of the game and if you could get the entire collection during a Steam sale, do it.

Posted: December 31, 2013
												This arguably one of the most in depth military games out there, the modding community has also really made some stellar missions, and other content. There is an entire website dedicated to new vehicles, weapons, camo, game over hauls, and maps. It really has something for everyone, and can also be modded to play the famous DayZ mod which has countless hours on its on. Arma II: OA really shouldn't be called a game, its more like a sampler. You can literally play exactly what you want, if its an idea there is a mod it really is a shining example of what cooperation between a developer and their fanbase should look like in the whole industry.The game can be demanding on your setup so make sure you have a good CPU, lots of ram, and decent graphics card. The settings cranked in this game make it pretty damn gorgeous so you will not be dissapointed. The game is often on sale as are all of the initial dlcs, which add various new things, and also unlock the full potential of high res texturing.

Posted: December 20, 2013
												This may be the greatest game in existence.Despite its many bugs and glitches it is a great game. Hundreds of hours of fun. Even with the amount of time I've put into this game I've barely scratched the surface. And most of that has come solely from the level editor.The editor is really fun to play around with, helicopter raids, tank missions, HALO jumps, patrols, ambushes, you name it, you can more than likely do it.The only real problem you might encounter with this game is its difficulty. There is a pretty steep learning curve to get used to it. Theres no second lives, theres no attack dog bonuses. It is probably as close as you'll ever get to war.I wouldn't recommend this to any looking for a quick, CoD style deathmatch. ArmA II's combat takes patience, practice and more patience. A definate must-buy for anyone looking for some large scale warfare, tactical combat or military simulation games.

Posted: January 5, 2013
												I am literally in LOVE with this game.Arma is one of the very few games that has managed to suck out 200+ hours out of me, without me getting bored of the content within game. It is an amazing game that you should have at least tried if you are a gamer, I mean c'mon the Multiplayer of Arma II is free, and the best parts of the game are in the multiplayer!Arma 2 OA is a standalone expansion from Arma 2 and it offers a completely new experience to the other game with a whole new upgrade to the look and feel of the game which is worth the full title cost. It is set in the fictional country of Takistan which is torn apart by the OpFor forces stationed there and is trying to be recovered by the BluFor forces stationed three. The game also allows the player to play in the old map Chernarus, but only if you own a copy of Arma II or have the Arma II Free game installed. The single player gives you the experience of being there and commanding a unit. The single player also features parts where you are in control of your superiors and takes a different direction of how a mission is played. What it does is it gives you and objective, guidelines, but you don’t necessarily have to follow them, but for the sake of story and depth its best to play within reason. The game allows you to learn from your mistakes, adapt or play in way that nobody else has, For example I was in a mission where all my men died, and I had one injured man left, and I had to get to a rendezvous but we had to face about a chalk of men. From constantly dying in the mission, I learnt that I could not protect my teammate as he would die instantly from any damage, so instead of facing the enemy I ran off and took a stealth route, which I could complete but because of AI Intelligence, he couldn't. And it’s because of moments like that, that make the single player something really special.The multiplayer gives you an experience of user created gameplay that very few games allow you to do, and this is one of the trademarks of the series. With some game modes and missions that you can play together with others, most people prefer to play user generated missions or game modes. The mission side of things is very simple. You get given tools that with a basic knowledge of google search or scripting allow you to create a mission that could be put in the single player of the game itself. I myself have made a few of these types of missions, ranging from border patrols, races to a vehicle and weapon showcase created to test out all the vehicles and weapons in the game and enable anyone to learn how to fly a plane or helicopter in game, without getting yelled at for wasting a valuable asset in certain multiplayer game modes. Game modes made by independent developers or groups of people is where the main fan base of the game stands at. Some of these 'gems' include:-Domination, a team based game where you are part of an army working together fighting and liberating towns from the OpFor stationed in them. -DayZ which now has evolved into a standalone game, is a whole new game mode in which you are one of the many survivors of a zombie infestation and you try to live within that scenario getting over the many obstacles that would exist including in depth problems like health and blood loss and social problems like gangs bandits and trust.-I44 is a whole re-branding of the game. It’s called Invasion 1944 and is set during the invasion of American Troops into Europe. The whole game is remade with a WW2 feel, with iconic weapons, gear clothing and vehicles. You have at your disposal, the German, British and American army to play with playing historical battles or some of the user-Generated games modes within Arma II such as DayZ and Domination.-ACE Is an upgrade to the already semi realistic game that Arma is. It offers more depth, challenge and realism and is seen as a mod for the more hard core fans, or people that like a more difficult game or a more enhancing experience in comparison to the vanilla version. It achieves this by adding little details everywhere such as fainting and ear protection from explosions. Also it adds more difficulty with things like shooting and stamina making the game that one step more realistic.-WasteLand is a scavenge and co-operate game mode in which players must earn money to make and but defences for their team, with a goal of domination and annihilation of the other team and the land around. The last game mode I want to talk about RP civilian life or as it’s now known as 'RPG Life'. This game mode adds a Sims like aspect to the game, as you play a civilian who can live his life normally or he can become a criminal or rebel and fight the police force who are in charge of keeping peace in the country. With trading, working and doing normal things like eating and drinking this game mode is one that will never be the same twice. Now this isn’t a full review of the game so I'll stop at the game modes and not expand any further as I could go on forever, talking about this game. So in short I give this game a 85/100, the reasons?Some Positives:-Has a decent campaign with a whole new approach to how a mission can be done-The multiplayer is and unlimited canvas with almost unlimited potential.-The community is a wide and strong one adding a lot to the game itself.-The Semi-Realism is an enhancing experience that adds on a lot to the game.Some Negatives:-There are a lot of fundamental ideas that are expected to be seen in sandboxes that are missing.-There could have been a lot more things done by the developers than just leaving the community to handle it and where there was support it was usually not in the places needed-There are some really bad flaws in AI and horrible animations that really take away from the game

Posted: August 20, 2012
												What is my perfect crime? I break into Tiffany's at midnight. Do I go for the vault? No. I go for the chandelier; it's priceless. As I'm taking it down, a woman catches me. She tells me to stop. It's her father's business. She's Tiffany. I say no. We make love all night. In the morning the cops come and I escape in one of their uniforms. I tell her to meet me in Mexico but I go to Canada. I don't trust her. Besides, I love the cold. Thirty years later I get a postcard. I have a son. And he's the Chief of Police. This is where the story gets interesting: I tell Tiffany to meet me in Paris by the Trocadero. She's been waiting for me all these years. She's never taken another lover. I don't care. I don't show up. I go to Berlin. That's where I stashed the chandelier.

Posted: April 19, 2014
												This is a really good Military Simulator. there are tons of guns, armaments, objects, etc. you can use to create whatever kind of situation you see fit. like rebels stealing NATO supplies, or US marines taking over Russian FOBs. plus this game has tons of mods, including the infamous ACE/ACRE mod and the ever popular DayZ mod. gamespy might be shutting down next month, but this game will be ever so strong in the Multiplayer department. besides the mods, there are tons of realism units out there, like th 15th MEU and the JTF207, there's a clan out there for everyone. and if you arent into clan based dealings, maybe you could try your hand at an Role Playing server? there are different kinds of RP Life servers on ArmA 2 OA, such as the common Chernarus and Takistan life servers, to ones such as City Life RP and TCG RP servers. like the realism units, there's a community for everyone. the greatness of this game is that you have the freedom to do what ever you want, how you want it, and when you want it.

												ARMA II Operation Arrowhead and it's brother, ARMA II, are both fantastic games that, at times, can feel more like a movie then a game. Posted: January 24, 2015
												I know this is not Arma II, but normal Arma II wont let me write a review. Arma is a Great Game, one of the best warfare games out there. For new players this game is no call of duty, its only 100 times better and more realistic. For you battlefield vets, you might feel a little more comfortable, but do not be mistaken this game is hard as s***. Everything is realistic, bullet drop, weapon accuracy, anniexty attacks, aiming after sprinting. My biggest advice is COVER and PAITENCE.  If you want to succed, you need to understand the aiming and then waiting it out and choosing the right positions and stances for you and your team is key to not dying over and over and over and over and over. The Story Is Great, the main storyline takes you on a trip of Razor team a UNSC recon squad. Memebers Sergant Miles, Sergant Cooper, Sergant Skypes, Sergant Brian, and Sergant Rodriguez. They are part of the USA invasion force of Chernarus in efforts to pervent an evil Cherno force from over throwing the government. Decisions and failures affect the outcome, Thats right this game has 3 endings. How you play is up to you, Chernarus's future lies in your hands. Failure to stop so will lead to the destruction of Chernarus or Russian complete domination of the region. Will you save the country or doom it? I give this game a 9.5 out of 10. The only reason why i don't give it a perfect 10 is AI are dumb sometimes and that normal Arma II has no more Servers to play normal Warface or annex or things like that. The DLC for this game is great for the most part, I highly recommend Operation Arrowhead, the dlc runs 10 times smoother on the new map and you can play normal Arma II on it. It is smooth offers a brand new map and tons of new weapons, tanks, and helis and cars. The story it has is kinda bland, but offers a fun new cool story. It offers a brand new multiplayer. There are some servers for normal warfare still running, but full servers are hard to come by for normal Conquest as I call it. Most people are friendly and team work is highly encouraged. Dont be stupid and you might make new friends. DayZ is also Extremely great, but I will write a entire review for that later, but with the stand alone out fewer normal DayZ servers are out and the modded servers are just filled with douches and bandits who have no honor. It is survival horror people, you should survive and Roleplaying only makes it ten times greater. I hope to see some of you out there on Arma II and DayZ. So what are you waiting for, Buy this game and see what lies in store for you. See you on the battlefield.

												This game has a very good multiplayer experience. It's realism will immerse you as if you are really there. There are a variety of guns that not only look like their real-life counterparts, but also act like them. Vehicles in this game are also pretty good. They look pretty much the same with their real-life counter parts but are not that realistic (rocks can easily flip your tank). Some problems with the servers though; it can be easily hack. Also, the controls are rather complicated and practically takes half of your keyboard. The campaign is uninteresting as the characters are flat, the voice acting is unconvincing, and the storyline sucks. But the multiplayer- even though servers are often hacked - are well worth it.

Posted: August 31, 2013
												An amazing game that I have sunk so many hours into, this game is the height of FPS and FPS-Strategy, this Military Simulator offers many modes, missions and it's own editor.Modes - The main modes are:Campaign - The main ARMA 2 campaign with additional DLC campaigns, you can also input player-made campaigns into this by pasting them into the folder.Missions - Random missions that can either be played in singleplayer with AI or multiplayer with some mates, the developers were so generous to include scripted missions to show off the potential of the editor, even the campaign was made with the editor!Editor - Probrally the best thing about the game, the in-game editor, a VERY simple layout of the map where you can plot units, vehicles, buildings, groups, etc and give them objectives, or if you're proficent, scripts. The editor utilizes everything about the game and is A LOT of fun, you can make huge battles, EVAC missions, training missions, anything you can think off!Gamemodes - There are a variety of gamemodes that're imputted into the game, the main one is CTI (Capture the Island), however, there are many player made ones, such as Takistani Life, Domination, Wasteland and many more.ARMA 2 OA is a amazing game offering a endless amount of possibities and is why I have sunk over 300 hours onto it, it is a great game and is so unique, unlike many FPS shooters these days... *cough* Call of Duty *cough* It's cheap, it's fun and if you can break through the learning curve, you'll LOVE this game! 10/10 - True game of the decade!

Posted: December 20, 2013
												This may be the greatest game in existence.Despite its many bugs and glitches it is a great game. Hundreds of hours of fun. Even with the amount of time I've put into this game I've barely scratched the surface. And most of that has come solely from the level editor.The editor is really fun to play around with, helicopter raids, tank missions, HALO jumps, patrols, ambushes, you name it, you can more than likely do it.The only real problem you might encounter with this game is its difficulty. There is a pretty steep learning curve to get used to it. Theres no second lives, theres no attack dog bonuses. It is probably as close as you'll ever get to war.I wouldn't recommend this to any looking for a quick, CoD style deathmatch. ArmA II's combat takes patience, practice and more patience. A definate must-buy for anyone looking for some large scale warfare, tactical combat or military simulation games.

												Arma 2:OA is one of the better games of our time. Although clunky, the game provides a great military-sim experience. A great deal of Arma's success is probably due to the widely popular mod, DayZ. Although DayZ takes the fame, there are dozens of other flushed out mods, such as BattleRoyal and Wasteland that have a large population. It is also relatively simple to create your own custom game or mod using the editing tools that are provided within the game. The game also features a series of campaigns that are worth your time. Overall, I would highly recommend this game, especially if one is a little bit hesitant on the price tag for Arma 3.

Posted: January 5, 2013
												I am literally in LOVE with this game.Arma is one of the very few games that has managed to suck out 200+ hours out of me, without me getting bored of the content within game. It is an amazing game that you should have at least tried if you are a gamer, I mean c'mon the Multiplayer of Arma II is free, and the best parts of the game are in the multiplayer!Arma 2 OA is a standalone expansion from Arma 2 and it offers a completely new experience to the other game with a whole new upgrade to the look and feel of the game which is worth the full title cost. It is set in the fictional country of Takistan which is torn apart by the OpFor forces stationed there and is trying to be recovered by the BluFor forces stationed three. The game also allows the player to play in the old map Chernarus, but only if you own a copy of Arma II or have the Arma II Free game installed. The single player gives you the experience of being there and commanding a unit. The single player also features parts where you are in control of your superiors and takes a different direction of how a mission is played. What it does is it gives you and objective, guidelines, but you don’t necessarily have to follow them, but for the sake of story and depth its best to play within reason. The game allows you to learn from your mistakes, adapt or play in way that nobody else has, For example I was in a mission where all my men died, and I had one injured man left, and I had to get to a rendezvous but we had to face about a chalk of men. From constantly dying in the mission, I learnt that I could not protect my teammate as he would die instantly from any damage, so instead of facing the enemy I ran off and took a stealth route, which I could complete but because of AI Intelligence, he couldn't. And it’s because of moments like that, that make the single player something really special.The multiplayer gives you an experience of user created gameplay that very few games allow you to do, and this is one of the trademarks of the series. With some game modes and missions that you can play together with others, most people prefer to play user generated missions or game modes. The mission side of things is very simple. You get given tools that with a basic knowledge of google search or scripting allow you to create a mission that could be put in the single player of the game itself. I myself have made a few of these types of missions, ranging from border patrols, races to a vehicle and weapon showcase created to test out all the vehicles and weapons in the game and enable anyone to learn how to fly a plane or helicopter in game, without getting yelled at for wasting a valuable asset in certain multiplayer game modes. Game modes made by independent developers or groups of people is where the main fan base of the game stands at. Some of these 'gems' include:-Domination, a team based game where you are part of an army working together fighting and liberating towns from the OpFor stationed in them. -DayZ which now has evolved into a standalone game, is a whole new game mode in which you are one of the many survivors of a zombie infestation and you try to live within that scenario getting over the many obstacles that would exist including in depth problems like health and blood loss and social problems like gangs bandits and trust.-I44 is a whole re-branding of the game. It’s called Invasion 1944 and is set during the invasion of American Troops into Europe. The whole game is remade with a WW2 feel, with iconic weapons, gear clothing and vehicles. You have at your disposal, the German, British and American army to play with playing historical battles or some of the user-Generated games modes within Arma II such as DayZ and Domination.-ACE Is an upgrade to the already semi realistic game that Arma is. It offers more depth, challenge and realism and is seen as a mod for the more hard core fans, or people that like a more difficult game or a more enhancing experience in comparison to the vanilla version. It achieves this by adding little details everywhere such as fainting and ear protection from explosions. Also it adds more difficulty with things like shooting and stamina making the game that one step more realistic.-WasteLand is a scavenge and co-operate game mode in which players must earn money to make and but defences for their team, with a goal of domination and annihilation of the other team and the land around. The last game mode I want to talk about RP civilian life or as it’s now known as 'RPG Life'. This game mode adds a Sims like aspect to the game, as you play a civilian who can live his life normally or he can become a criminal or rebel and fight the police force who are in charge of keeping peace in the country. With trading, working and doing normal things like eating and drinking this game mode is one that will never be the same twice. Now this isn’t a full review of the game so I'll stop at the game modes and not expand any further as I could go on forever, talking about this game. So in short I give this game a 85/100, the reasons?Some Positives:-Has a decent campaign with a whole new approach to how a mission can be done-The multiplayer is and unlimited canvas with almost unlimited potential.-The community is a wide and strong one adding a lot to the game itself.-The Semi-Realism is an enhancing experience that adds on a lot to the game.Some Negatives:-There are a lot of fundamental ideas that are expected to be seen in sandboxes that are missing.-There could have been a lot more things done by the developers than just leaving the community to handle it and where there was support it was usually not in the places needed-There are some really bad flaws in AI and horrible animations that really take away from the game

Posted: January 12, 2013
												I have never played a game quite like this. It is slightly "clunky" to play, in tending towards realism, but it manages to pull it off. It's hard to make a sandbox game immersive in my opinion, but nothing makes you feel like you're in a real world like dropping into Chernarus for one mission or another. Definitely not a twitch game, but you can experience what feels like total desolation wandering around the landscape with your rifle, coming across another player only infrequently, making the experience punctuated by panic. Of course everyone mostly bought this for DayZ and that mod is excellent, but I would recommend checking out some fun other basic OA missions like "Wasteland" or "Takistan Life".

Posted: October 20, 2014
												ARMA II Operation Arrowhead and it's brother, ARMA II, are both fantastic games that, at times, can feel more like a movie then a game. ARMA II can have the most cinematic feeling at times; your squad is wiped out, rescue bird has gone down and you're alone against oncoming swarms of hostile units that want to drag your dead corpse through the street and display your flak as a sign of victory, of have the deafing roar of the A-10 fly above your head and wipe that small town ahead of you to nothing more then a smoldering wreck of adobe and taliban weapon caches.I highly recommend this game to any one seeking a tactical and down to earth take on the modern FPS genre.

Posted: December 31, 2015
												ArmA 2 is the kind of game that was made only for the hardcore military shooter buffs. This game is so challenging and diffcult that it makes Call of Duty and Battlefield look like Angry Birds by comparission. Not everyone will like this game so I only recomended to military buffs and anyone who started playing military shooters back in the late 90's / early 2000's. Remeber the old school Rainbow Six or Ghost Recon, its basically those games on a massive scale. The game pays the greatest attention to details and realism as players must work with their team to complte their objective. Be it the single-player or multiplayer, ArmA 2 is true gift to the hardcore gamer.The exspansion packs / DLCs also add to the longevity of the game and if you could get the entire collection during a Steam sale, do it.

												I was selling oil when a 7 year-old demanded I give him my money before he pulled out a snub nosed revolver and shot the tire off my truck. I faked a surrender before punching him in the nose and grabbing the gun. Holding the gun steady, the iron sights positioned with his bald chrome dome right in the center, I said: "Make my day, punk." before I delivered a .357 round right in his forehead. As his blood splattered across the hot desert sands I holstered the weapon, walking around to the back of my truck and retrieving a handy tool-kit which I used to replace the flat tire. I drove away from that place, and that fresh corpse, with a tingling satisfaction. Yet, I still felt dissapointment. Why did it always have to come to violence?10/10 Would re-examine the depressing duality of human existence again

Posted: August 20, 2012
												"dayz mod is amazing.game itself is also great once you learn the mechanics." Heh, that was from 2012, wow.I picked up ARMA II primarily for the DayZ mod, which I kept hearing about on reddit. I eventually watched numerous gameplay videos of it and was captivated by the idea.Later, when I decided to try the rest of the game, I realized how amazing it was, the attention to detail was absolutely remarkable.If you like combat/army simulators (that's simulation, so you aren't going to be running around like in Call of Duty destroying everyone by yourself arcade-stylle), intense squad-based gameplay, realistic combat (bullet drop, zeroing your sights, etc), and challenging gameplay, then you will love ARMA II.The aesthetics are fantastic, so much so that you are strongly advised to run the benchmark missions (yes, it comes with benchmark missions) to see how it will run on your PC, and during different scenarios (moving, firefights, explosions, etc). The music and sounds are stellar - with enough practice, you can actually tell what type of weapon was fired, and the approximate distance. You'll even be able to differentiate the different model types with enough experience.The controls take some time to get used to. You do a lot of micromanaging with your mouse - to refill ammo you will need to open your backpack then manually chamber the new magazine. Pack management is grid based, so you will need to make sure that each item actually fits into your pack. The learning curve is moderate to very difficult if you are not familiar with combat/war simulators, and playing the tutorials is strongly advised (if not mandatory) if you expect to understand how to play the game.The gameplay is incredible! Mod support is very strong, and I recommend you check out the available selection for the particular mods that fit with the playstyle you desire (many make the game even more realistic, as if it weren't realistic enough). There are vehicles you can use, and many intro missions allow you to test the different factions, vehicles, and equipment. The story is pretty good, with lots of variety in free missions. There is a mission I play over and over again that is extremely expansive - you are tasked with taking over the majority of the map. As commander of the mission, you can build structures (like more barracks, weapon emplacements) and hire reinforcements (purchase vehicles, recruit snipers, commando teams) to help you achieve your goal. As you succeed in liberating different areas, you will be awarded with more cash.The reason why I play this mission over and over again is because it is really fun and there are countless ways for you to proceed through the mission (you can attack different areas, and with different army set ups). Another reason why I play this particular mission over and over again is because I keep dying by the second major firefight I get into. The game is extremely challenging, even for seasoned gamers.Overall, if you like difficult scenarios and realistic combat, you must give this game a chance. The DayZ mod is a nice bonus. Highly recommend!

Posted: March 3, 2014
												Arma 2: OA is a wonderful military simulator, boasting tons of fantastic mods. DayZ has fueled Arma 2, allowing it to rise up into popularity and giving people a look at the sim. Though, sure, you can buy Arma 2 just for the DayZ mod or Wasteland, but Arma 2 can hold itself up on its own, with the mods that base themselves around it being nice little bonuses that keep you from running out of content.The engine's core issues do detract from this. The game is easy to run on singleplayer, but multiplayer is rather taxing. The engine doesn't utilize your resources that well, which doesn't result in fun. Though I can mess around on anything vanilla Arma 2 at very high with a steady and smooth framerate, modded multiplayer gamemodes appear to completely wreck the FPS even at low, which is what prevented me from playing DayZ. Due to this, I played Arma 2: OA and Arma 2 as Armas instead of modding bases, and still had a lot of fun.The gunplay is solid, realistic, and tense. The controls are a bit clunky, and the first person view is annoyingly shakey, but third person holds up (but can easily be exploited.) The AI can be rather stupid at times, and singleplayer is rather harsh, forcing you to restart if you meet your death, but it is rather fun to play missions you pick up from the community or just try some of the base ones, or even make your own.

Posted: November 30, 2013
												ARMA II is a spectacular mil-sim that's all about tactics and strategy, running and gunning won't get you far here. This game features a wide variety of firearms, big and small, as well as vehicles and aircaft that can really change the tide of battle. ARMA focuses on representing it's wide assortment of toys accurately, you will find a level of detail here that is uncommon in most other shooters. That being said, it does not achieve full simulation of most things. You could probably find more accurate car characteristics in a racing game, and better aircraft simulation in a dedicated flight-sim game. It doesn't matter though, the combines arms feeling this game creates will make you feel like you're in a real battlefield.If there was one thing I had to complain about, it would have to be the 'feel' of moving and aiming. To me, everything feels very clunky and tougher than it should be. If you like a tactical experience of a battlefield, get this game. It really shines, in a small squad with your friends breaching a house, or in a huge battle in a city, this game is great for all aspects of war. My recommendation: Join/host a game of domination or insurgency with a group of friends, both are very fun experiences that my buddies and I couldn't stop playing for hours.

Posted: November 29, 2013
												ArmA II: OA is a great game which when put together with ArmA II to make ArmA II: Combined Operations can cover all the weaknesses OA had when compared to ArmA II.Though the game takes a bit of dedication to get comfortable with, once you get used to the control system it has a massive amount to offer. It has a massive choice of weapons, vehicles and troops, along with having Combined Operations you have access to two massive maps (Takistan 164 km2 and Chernarus is 225 km2), one desert and one in a forested country.Apart from the games vanilla mechanics is the massive modding community surrounding ArmA II. These can change the game in massive ways as well as add to them. Everything from DayZ, a zombie survival, to ACE, Adding new sounds, items, vehicles and mechanics to increase the realism and plausibility of game mechanics, such as first aid.After experiencing the vanilla game and maybe a modded version which is all multiplayer friendly with servers scailing over 100 slots which run smooth, you can go into the games editor which allows you to create fully scripted missions with or without mods, with a user friendly interface that lets you make simple missions, test them and make them instantly multiplayer.I would recommend this game to anyone who likes simulators or squad based shooters, though it would depend on how comfortable with mouse and keyboard they are as a gamepad just wont work with this. make sure to pick it up in a sale as you can buy ArmA II and ArmA II: OA which gives you content from both in one, for a stupidly cheap price for a game which you can easily spend hundreds of hours on.

Posted: June 23, 2016
												Arma 2:OA is one of the better games of our time. Although clunky, the game provides a great military-sim experience. A great deal of Arma's success is probably due to the widely popular mod, DayZ. Although DayZ takes the fame, there are dozens of other flushed out mods, such as BattleRoyal and Wasteland that have a large population. It is also relatively simple to create your own custom game or mod using the editing tools that are provided within the game. The game also features a series of campaigns that are worth your time. Overall, I would highly recommend this game, especially if one is a little bit hesitant on the price tag for Arma 3.

Posted: December 26, 2014
												This is going to be a not so informative review of Arma 2.The game itself is a fun game, and has a lot of realistic elements to it, as it should to fit the simulator category. I heavily enjoyed it for that purpose and also the fact that it was heavily moddable to create a unique community filled with plenty of games to play. There is just one problem that was very very much so of a problem within this game; The game's Engine. The engine that makes this game run is absolutely terrible, it's incrediblyt clunky, and extremely unoptimized, even though this game is made when it was, it still can struggle to run on high end PC's of today in 2014. 												Okay let me start off by saying I have many more hours of gametime than listed above and experience in other ArmA games in the series.  I originally bought this game mainly for Dayz but quickly realized this game has extremely unique and untapped potential in its singleplayer and other vanilla multiplayer modes if you are patient enough to learn how to play them. This game is everything in one a military simulator, ♥♥♥♥ around and troll simulator, building and management, player crafting, open world exploring, mass vehicle battles, zombie apocalypse survival, you name it. This game will give you a unique experience everytime no matter how many hours you place into this you can make friends, have amazing friendships, and betray them and steal everything they love within minutes. Drive around, kidnap innocent people, make them undress, and then shoot them in the legs forcing them to crawl to survival while they get eaten alive by zombies. What's not to love? 10/10 most realistic and unrealistic simulator ever, best to play with a couple of friends. But be wary of strangers you meet, they may shoot you and steal your baked beans. Protect your beans.

												This is a really good Military Simulator. there are tons of guns, armaments, objects, etc. you can use to create whatever kind of situation you see fit. like rebels stealing NATO supplies, or US marines taking over Russian FOBs. plus this game has tons of mods, including the infamous ACE/ACRE mod and the ever popular DayZ mod. gamespy might be shutting down next month, but this game will be ever so strong in the Multiplayer department. besides the mods, there are tons of realism units out there, like th 15th MEU and the JTF207, there's a clan out there for everyone. and if you arent into clan based dealings, maybe you could try your hand at an Role Playing server? there are different kinds of RP Life servers on ArmA 2 OA, such as the common Chernarus and Takistan life servers, to ones such as City Life RP and TCG RP servers. like the realism units, there's a community for everyone. the greatness of this game is that you have the freedom to do what ever you want, how you want it, and when you want it.

												ARMA II Operation Arrowhead and it's brother, ARMA II, are both fantastic games that, at times, can feel more like a movie then a game. ARMA II can have the most cinematic feeling at times; your squad is wiped out, rescue bird has gone down and you're alone against oncoming swarms of hostile units that want to drag your dead corpse through the street and display your flak as a sign of victory, of have the deafing roar of the A-10 fly above your head and wipe that small town ahead of you to nothing more then a smoldering wreck of adobe and taliban weapon caches.I highly recommend this game to any one seeking a tactical and down to earth take on the modern FPS genre.

Posted: August 31, 2013
												An amazing game that I have sunk so many hours into, this game is the height of FPS and FPS-Strategy, this Military Simulator offers many modes, missions and it's own editor.Modes - The main modes are:Campaign - The main ARMA 2 campaign with additional DLC campaigns, you can also input player-made campaigns into this by pasting them into the folder.Missions - Random missions that can either be played in singleplayer with AI or multiplayer with some mates, the developers were so generous to include scripted missions to show off the potential of the editor, even the campaign was made with the editor!Editor - Probrally the best thing about the game, the in-game editor, a VERY simple layout of the map where you can plot units, vehicles, buildings, groups, etc and give them objectives, or if you're proficent, scripts. The editor utilizes everything about the game and is A LOT of fun, you can make huge battles, EVAC missions, training missions, anything you can think off!Gamemodes - There are a variety of gamemodes that're imputted into the game, the main one is CTI (Capture the Island), however, there are many player made ones, such as Takistani Life, Domination, Wasteland and many more.ARMA 2 OA is a amazing game offering a endless amount of possibities and is why I have sunk over 300 hours onto it, it is a great game and is so unique, unlike many FPS shooters these days... *cough* Call of Duty *cough* It's cheap, it's fun and if you can break through the learning curve, you'll LOVE this game! 10/10 - True game of the decade!

												I know this is not Arma II, but normal Arma II wont let me write a review. Arma is a Great Game, one of the best warfare games out there. For new players this game is no call of duty, its only 100 times better and more realistic. For you battlefield vets, you might feel a little more comfortable, but do not be mistaken this game is hard as s***. Everything is realistic, bullet drop, weapon accuracy, anniexty attacks, aiming after sprinting. My biggest advice is COVER and PAITENCE.  If you want to succed, you need to understand the aiming and then waiting it out and choosing the right positions and stances for you and your team is key to not dying over and over and over and over and over. The Story Is Great, the main storyline takes you on a trip of Razor team a UNSC recon squad. Memebers Sergant Miles, Sergant Cooper, Sergant Skypes, Sergant Brian, and Sergant Rodriguez. They are part of the USA invasion force of Chernarus in efforts to pervent an evil Cherno force from over throwing the government. Decisions and failures affect the outcome, Thats right this game has 3 endings. How you play is up to you, Chernarus's future lies in your hands. Failure to stop so will lead to the destruction of Chernarus or Russian complete domination of the region. Will you save the country or doom it? I give this game a 9.5 out of 10. The only reason why i don't give it a perfect 10 is AI are dumb sometimes and that normal Arma II has no more Servers to play normal Warface or annex or things like that. The DLC for this game is great for the most part, I highly recommend Operation Arrowhead, the dlc runs 10 times smoother on the new map and you can play normal Arma II on it. It is smooth offers a brand new map and tons of new weapons, tanks, and helis and cars. The story it has is kinda bland, but offers a fun new cool story. It offers a brand new multiplayer. There are some servers for normal warfare still running, but full servers are hard to come by for normal Conquest as I call it. Most people are friendly and team work is highly encouraged. Dont be stupid and you might make new friends. DayZ is also Extremely great, but I will write a entire review for that later, but with the stand alone out fewer normal DayZ servers are out and the modded servers are just filled with douches and bandits who have no honor. It is survival horror people, you should survive and Roleplaying only makes it ten times greater. I hope to see some of you out there on Arma II and DayZ. So what are you waiting for, Buy this game and see what lies in store for you. See you on the battlefield.

Posted: March 3, 2014
												Arma 2: OA is a wonderful military simulator, boasting tons of fantastic mods. DayZ has fueled Arma 2, allowing it to rise up into popularity and giving people a look at the sim. Though, sure, you can buy Arma 2 just for the DayZ mod or Wasteland, but Arma 2 can hold itself up on its own, with the mods that base themselves around it being nice little bonuses that keep you from running out of content.The engine's core issues do detract from this. The game is easy to run on singleplayer, but multiplayer is rather taxing. The engine doesn't utilize your resources that well, which doesn't result in fun. Though I can mess around on anything vanilla Arma 2 at very high with a steady and smooth framerate, modded multiplayer gamemodes appear to completely wreck the FPS even at low, which is what prevented me from playing DayZ. Due to this, I played Arma 2: OA and Arma 2 as Armas instead of modding bases, and still had a lot of fun.The gunplay is solid, realistic, and tense. The controls are a bit clunky, and the first person view is annoyingly shakey, but third person holds up (but can easily be exploited.) The AI can be rather stupid at times, and singleplayer is rather harsh, forcing you to restart if you meet your death, but it is rather fun to play missions you pick up from the community or just try some of the base ones, or even make your own.

Posted: April 18, 2016
												Allow me to tell you a story about one of my many DAYZ experiences.I was an experienced, well equipped and ruthless bandit settled down in the northwestern region of Chernarussia on my favorite Epoch server. I was camping a medical mission, ever so carefully scanning the treeline with the scope mounted on my Designated Marksman Rifle. Just as I was about to give in and depart back to my base, I saw a rather distraught, careless Bambi wandering through the treeline I had been scanning. At the time, I was situated in a grouping of thick bushes, wearing a ghillie suit to camouflage me from anyone who dared to oppose me. I grinned, thinking that with one left click I could drop another pathetic Bambi, adding another murder to my endless list. I was about to do just that, when the Bambi turned, and looked straight at me. He stopped dead in his tracks, a look of regret and fear painted over his face. He held only a 5.56 mm M4A1 in his grasp, and wore the default spawn model. For the first time in my bandit experience, I felt sympathy. I felt like there was more meaning to this game than to mindlessly kill fellow survivors. My heart dropped when I realized that I had carelessly murdered hundreds of others like him. It was this moment I had decided to muster up the little humanity left in my heart, and spare the poor fellow. I felt good about my decision. I stood up, grinning ear to ear. I mashed the Q and E keys on my keyboard, indicating I was friendly. And then suddenly, a gunshot rang out, the bullet whizzing right passed my ear. I stood there in disbelief. The Bambi's gun was smoking, his face detirmed, filled with stupidity and bloodthirst.Except he was playing on a♥♥♥♥♥♥machine that granted him most likely a pathetic 10 FPS. I chuckled to myself, and blasted the sorry ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥'s brains onto the trees behind him.One more Bambi added to my list. He was among much more to come in the future. It was worth tho cus he had mtn dew on him that sold for a hefty one 10oz gold my nig

content:
Posted: February 25, 2015
												I played OFP ( still do ) for hours and hours, online, offline, modded or Vanilla. Back in those days i was amazed by the immersion and realism ( as in how hard it actually is to hit targets while running for your life ) and the well though off storyline. Then came ARMA ( still play that too ) and ARMA II and graphics improved, AI got better and a whole new world opened with addons like ACE and a diversity of vehicles and units ( even our proud Dutch army is modded...wich makes me proud as i served there for 15 years ). So, the Pro's :Modding is almost endless...annything you might want, it's there...It looks and feels nice, but on older systems you will have to trade looks for performance because it's a heavy game!Con's :The campaign is virtually unplayable, buggs and triggers / scripts that don't work can make your game feel incomplete.It's NOT an ARCADE type, Battlefield, COD shooter...there's a steep learning curve for firsttimers.Conclusion :Is it worth buying? Hell YES it is! If you like tactical and full immersive online war, this is your thing.

Posted: February 27, 2014
												One of the reasons to why i built myself a computer, was that Arma 2 was only available on PC. Arma II Operation Arrowhead is what i would describe as the best Mil Sim that is commerically available. Released in 2010, Operation Arrowhead expanded the features of Arma II and enhanced the game a lot. Instead of playing in Chernarus, a new map, Takistan was introduced to the Mix. A combination of Dunes, Settlements and Airbases is what made this map special for me. Honestly, Most of my time was spent on the mission editior, just making new scenarios for my friends when we would play multiplayer. You have to have a basic understanding of programming in order to make Fluid and Fun mission, as the Mission editor does not hold your hand, it throws you out into the big world, where you either consult forums or learn by trial and error. In regards to gameplay, the game feels right, the game world can be very dynamic. Vehicals and Weapons is what really makes the game here. There are over 300 weapons (including Variations) and 80 Vehicles. The Vehicles handle nicely, and weapons feel authentic, except for the gunfire sounds. Squad interaction and Commanding is a big thing in the game, and it works very well, the AI will move stealthily, hide, and ambush on your command. Moving on, The Graphics are nothing spectacular, but they are not bad either, mostly the textures and lighting are a bit dodgy. Another problem is that the game is not very well optimised, so AA and ATOC will drop your frame rate by a lot unless you have a high end card. Apart from those issues, the graphics are okay. There is a campaign in the game, however, it is seldom played through to my knowledge. But the campaign is solid, nothing special to it, and not to forget that the voice acting is quite frankly, terrible. Finally, the main reason to why people love this game, is the Multiplayer. Servers can handle up to 100+ players, and many of these servers often have an emphasis on millitary simulation, so you have the full package; Real tactics, Radio Chatter, and team play. The multiplayer world is also a bit unforgiving, as it can happen that you play for 20 minutes and not encounter a single enemy, and as soon as you encounter your eney, he kills you in one shot. well, such is warfare. I recommend this game to millitary enthusiats and people who want to play a realistic team based gameGameplay: 9/10Campaign: 5/10Graphics:   6/10Multiplayer: 10/10P.S There are thousands of mods for this game

												Writing this post DayZ SA release. I get the feeling that the mod will be popular for a good while yet since the standalone just isn't quite there yet and people enjoy mods like Epoch and things the SA doesn't have so there's that still. Apart from that, the game is amazing. It has a steep learning curve but if you can stick with it and get past that, the game is too good. The map(s) are huge and Chernarus in particular is something special. The amount of different game modes (excluding DayZ variations) is enough to keep you playing for many hundreds, possibly thousands of hours. Game modes go from small 8 player missions to massive 100+ servers / missions. I'm really♥♥♥♥♥♥at trying to say why this is good but there's an attempt.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												I originally bought the game just to play DayZ Epoch, which I can say I loved...I really had no interest in another military first person shooter, I already played enough, the Battlefield series (Great series) , Medal of Honor (Good series) , America's Army (O.K.) and Call of Duty series (Garbage), I know all you CoD fan-boys will hate me for that, but in my opinion it went down hill after Call of Duty 2 . Then the DayZ Epoch server I played on shut down, shortly there after my friend who got me playing, stop playing and went on to other games, and my Arma 2 collections sat un-played.From time to time I would try other DayZ mods and servers, most filled with jerks and hackers...Then I discovered DaiZy a single player mod of DayZ, I started playing again and trying some of the different DaiZy mods available, I was having fun again...that lead to finding other mods for the Arma 2 collection like Day of Survival and a host of others...Now I play DaiZy, DoS and the actual game and I love it.I have to say it's the Best Military First Person Shooter I have ever played, and with all the different mods out there for it and the ability to edit your own missions it has a ton of re-play value!I highly recommend buying the whole Arma 2 collection if you want a in depth Military First Person Shooter with a ton of different way to play!

Posted: September 11, 2015
												Pros:Ultra-Realistic Combat when playing with the right people. Resembles helmet-cam combat footage from Iraq.Higher Settings = better FPS for some people, somehow. Realistic sounds and visuals. Realistic uniforms and diversity in different militaries around the world. A bright and creative modding community. Class diversity. Cons:Few available servers. 90% Modded servers (Lookin at you DayZ) Occasional bad FPSNearly Pointless classesThe opportunity to Run & Gun COD-style is still present. Lack of variety in weapons (made up for by the detail and variety in types of weapons. Example: About 13 different Ak's)You bought Arma II? Congrats! Allow us to announce that you now must purchas Operation Arrowhead to play online. All-in-all, a great combat simulator. Not recommended for casual players.

Posted: December 7, 2013
												Arma 2 OA is a great game all around. It's a bit buggy, and the graphics are not exactly stunning, but it is realistic and fun, if you know where to look. The Level Editor is fun to mess around with (think 500 vehicles and helis and planes fighting in a desert filled with chickens) and the single missions (scenarios) contain lots of content, too. The campaigns are lengthy and are diverse. Downloadable content is available, adding even more replayability. Of course, you can't forget that the DayZ Mod requires Arma 2 and Arma 2 OA. The multiplayer is largely unused, since DayZ is what the large majority of the players do with Arma 2. I would highly recommend this to anyone with any sort of FPS interests, and especially if you are interested in zombies games, due to the DayZ mod

content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												After being a fan favorite, from my early childhood, this game has truly tested time.With amazing sounds, graphics, and combat, it felt too real for 2010. From the aminious forests and valleys in the northern sectors, to the barren fields where you expect an entire army to start firing at you, this game immerses and involves you.As well, as being home to coop domination, team deathmatch, and more, Arma 2/Arma 2 OA brought and sustained one of its best, FREE, modded expansionsDrumroll please.........DAYZ!Featuring a new way to play, with scavenging, surviving and adapting, Dayz brought a whole new aspect to the Arma environment. Whereas before, you would ignore enemy weapons, explosives and clothing, you now needed to loot and make sure you had enough bullets, food and supplies for any situation...Whereas before, you'd be dissapointed you'd died, and have to respawn at base or restart the mission, Dayz stressed, and panicked you. If you died, you would probably lose your gear forever, lost in the Coyote Backpack of that ghilie bandit at Sniper Hill. Additionally, the game branched out and expanded tremendously out of Vanilla Dayz.Modders added bases (my favorite), new guns/sounds, new maps, new vehicles, a new economy system, and SO MUCH MORE!If a game truly has the best modding community, it's Arma.I hope, that Bohemia continues to create and enhance the Arma experience, in future installments and updates, fixing glitches and annoyances, like physics, destruction, medical treatments, and more.But if you can get a group of 2-3 friends, get in a group chat, and load up this game, it will amaze you with a brilliantly crafted, Tactial masterpiece.Arma 2/ Arma 2 OA: 9.5/10

												First off, this game is one of the greatest experiences I've had on PC since I got into Steam a few years ago.  The development, game play, realism, and everything about this game just makes it a great milsim, whether hardcore or amateur.  This is a great way to experience realistic combat in a danger-filled middle eastern theater environment.  Anyone looking to get into milsims, or just want to learn about true combat the way it is should DEFINITELY consider this game as something to have in your library.
